physical_appearance: This is an acknowledgement form stating receipt of letter. It is printed in black ink, with the fields filled in with handwritten inscription in blue ink. There is a registered number at the top left corner. The date is written at the top-right corner. The form is signed at the bottom right corner in black ink, above a purple stamp. There are no tears or folds seen on this document.
sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steeleâ€™s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Army acknowledgement form
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) acknowledgments letters (correspondence)
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Letters
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
